website_summaries.verdict: An affordably priced inversion table that offers an impressive amount of user-friendly features.
pros: Features a convenient pin system with 6 settings that lets you quickly choose your preferred angle of inversion from 15º to 90º
Accommodates users up to 6.5 feet tall
Adjustable headrest and footrest allow you to fine tune your center of gravity for easier operation
cons: You may need to add extra padding around the ankle supports to increase the comfort level

customer_reviews.title: Torcher chamber for short people.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not good if you are short or have small feet (I'm 63"). The ankle grips do not hold small legs well which makes it extremely painful to use. I even tried wearing boots to get better positioning, still a fail. I'm going to give it to someone bigger and hopefully it works better for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MAD !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The foot mount on this product was welded on the wrong side. We cannot finish the assembly. I have tried to get a number to call customer service with no LUCK !!! I would just like to know if we could be sent another foot piece to use. I also bought the extra warranty but, they did not help either. I guess I would say that I'm am extremely disgusted with the whole thing. I would just like to get some help with this issue.?? My rating now would be ⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Wrong used parts incuded in equipment
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable ankle holding tube was obviously a used part, it was all beat up and the plastic was warped and scratched. The worst part was that it was the wrong piece for the equipment. It did not match the assembly instructions nor the hardware needed for the connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Nekole Baurer

customer_reviews.title: look carefully at the photos
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product if the ankle pads were placed behind the legs instead of in front. Look carefully at the photos and installation instructions. The photos of the product match up to installation - the cushions are behind the legs and the ankle pads are in front. The photos of the person using the machine show the opposite. That would make this device useful - the installation configuration makes it extremely painful on the ankles and feet when inverted. There is no way that I can tell to change it to the more comfortable configuration. I have major bruises on my feet after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.author: KLE

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to return the item, but it's missing some parts. 4 pieces of the part number 31 (base end caps). Also it's missing part number 4 (footrest). The box looks like it was previously open. Please send missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: D. White

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and seems to work as my boyfriend hasn't complained once about his back since he started using it. my parents have a similar one and both use it and love it. My mother had a lot of pain in her hip and couldn't walk long and since using her table has little to no pain and can walk like she use to. However they paid 2x more for their table.
customer_reviews.author: danielle p.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Terrible craftsmanship!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible craftsmanship !!! After spending more than one hour unwrapping and putting it together, I found out that the left handle was so poorly welded (crooked) that it cannot be screwed to the V frame. The worst part of it is that I have to take it apart and try to repackage it the best I can in order to return it ! Total waste of my morning ! I bought it because of the numerous good reviews ! Definitely cannot recommend this product !
customer_reviews.author: Phil Mazure

customer_reviews.title: This product is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It was carefully assembled and used as instructed. After inverting myself about 60 degrees within the instructed time frame I experienced sever vertigo and rapid increase in blood pressure. It does nothing to improve spinal alignment, etc. and is health care quackery at its very worst.
customer_reviews.author: William Hammett

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money on something else
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the bottom braces we're misaligned so the entire thing in unbalanced. It does fold, however there is nothing to secure it so it just re opens when you try to move it. Folded "flat" on the ground is nearly 2 ft tall. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ankle supports are poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I tested a Teeter brand at Scheels. Awesome. So I went cheap and bought this one based on 4.5 stars. Unreal how painful the foot/shin "cushions" are. I will say it made me completely forget about back pain because my shins are so damn sore. (I am not a 297 pound person with unreal expectations, about 170 pounds). I even tried wearing ski boots! I want to make this work...does anyone have any retrofit ideas for how to soften the supports?? I think the problem is the distance from the foam calf support/front shin pads to the top of the foot. When inverting you slide too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: After putting this machine together I noticed that the handle bars are too wide and the setup itself does not fold flat enough to store under a bed. It is also difficult to transport from room to room because there is no locking mechanism to keep the legs from opening and closing. I'm a big guy 6'4 240lb and this thing crushed my finger and hurt leg while moving this thing from the bedroom to the livingroom. When I used the table, the leg supports were snug with no space and it felt like I was going to fall out. Doesn't feel that safe once fully inverted. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher  Kearse

customer_reviews.title: Almost killed me
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. It almost killed me the first time I used it. Luckily I didn’t let my guard down, within the first few minutes one of the welds broke right off. See the picture above smh.
customer_reviews.author: Jovr21e

customer_reviews.title: therefore I could not put machine together I have to go to mendards today and either buy a threader or fine the same style bolt
customer_reviews.text: I'm am highly dissatisfied with this purchase because they sent me screws with no threads... therefore I could not put machine together I have to go to mendards today and either buy a threader or fine the same style bolt.. ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: carl chandler

customer_reviews.title: Arm handle was torn and just not a very sturdy table.
customer_reviews.text: Damaged product. Tubing was bent and I couldn't put it together. Arm handle was torn and just not a very sturdy table.
customer_reviews.author: Garth Lurvey

customer_reviews.title: stress is on the feet above 45deg
customer_reviews.text: I got it to treat lower bk pain and numbness in the feet. It takes some conditioning to hang by the feet above 45deg. I tried gravity boots but it didnt work any better than thick socks and pulling my feet up against the ankle braces with the roller on my heels. I can last for 5min in this manner before fatique sets in. Exercises were not provided with the table or on the company website. I heard that twisting from side to side and situps can be done. A longer ankle brace release lever would prevent bending down to set & release the braces.
customer_reviews.author: semockr

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the packaging was trashed and when I opened it up there were broken parts inside. Secondly, the thing weighs a ton. Forget about moving it around or storing it when it's not in use. Third, The foot holders HURT! Saying they are uncomfortable when you're in this thing is an understatement. Lastly, you go from very inverted to practically upside down. There aren't very gradual settings to the inversion. It's going back today. Another ripoff by Amazon! That is why it is better to go to a store and see what you are actually buying as opposed to trying to understand by looking at a picture on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Got my life back!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! I received this last week Friday, and I have to say, It's a wonderful feeling to experience reduced pain. I have scoliosis which causes my hips, pelvis, and lumbar region to cramp,. making it difficult to walk or stand. On top of that, I now use less and less pain meds in order to function... I am a security guard and walk 5 to 12 miles in a shift. It's a wonderful feeling to walk pain free. As far as the stretching part, I am working into it gradually, allowing the back to adjust. You really have to ease yourself into this. Use caution.
customer_reviews.author: Steve w.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, but know the foot rest will limit you
customer_reviews.text: This inversion table does the trick to help stretch the back muscles. I’m not gonna try and make the claim that this thing miraculously cured all my back issues, but I sincerely believe incorporating inversion therapy cohesively with physical therapy has helped me to make drastic improvements in terms of strengthening my back after suffering from two bulging discs. This table is a great deal for the price, but the area which braces the feet while you invert is uncomfortable, and limits to amount of time I remain inverted drastically. I’ve switched the padding around, but I think this is one element of the table which could definitely use improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S.

customer_reviews.title: Distracts from back pain
customer_reviews.text: I don't notice my back pain as much when I frequently use this product but that's more due to the fact that my attention is drawn to my very sore ankles caused by using this product. It's a solidly built, well engineered product except for the fact it hurts the ankles likes crazy! One minute inverted, ankles fine back unchanged. Three minutes inverted, ankles extremely sore don't notice back pain anymore. Five minutes inverted, feet pull away from legs causing crash to my head... Don't mind the back pain anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What a unit!
customer_reviews.text: Took about 2 hours to assemble, the easiest instructions ever for a unit this size. It is larger than I thought but it sorta folds up but still BIG I set the machine up and finally figured out the best way to place myself (6'2" and 265lbs) into it and get it balanced right. Works well - start off with a low degree setting. If you have a wrench and ratchet set along with a good phillips screw driver it goes much easier - but they include all the tools needed. I now know why it gets high ratings! I would recommend it to anyone wanting to use an inversion machine.
customer_reviews.author: Harold C. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Review what Drs day about use for certain age groups
customer_reviews.text: We never opened the box, it came and that day I had a conversation with our Dr. he stated they are not recommended for people over 55, because of possibility for stroke. I then reviewed comments by Mayo Clinic, I think Amazon should have done some type of a statement about risks to certain age groups We had to pay 38.00 shipping. My husband and I are over 80.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: This table is our first inversion table so I don’t have much to review it against. It was affordable and I feel it was worth the price. I feel like inverting definitely helps with pain relief but the part where it holds you (the ankle/top of foot) hurts.... we’ve tried different methods and it always causes medium to severe discomfort. I feel like they should improve the ankle part to where it’s a more secure hold.. overall it’s a good table and we use it often!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Foot holders hurt!
customer_reviews.text: The foot holders hurt really bad....your not really able to use the product or test it out, it’s very painful.
customer_reviews.author: G H

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product cheap manufacturing bad bad bad
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in defective condition. But you could not see it before you assemble it. It took a few hours so don’t waste your time on this cheaply manufactured product. Safety pin fall out during use and it could fold while I was upside down and paralyze me. Contacted amazon they told me to return it which is barely impossible on a big product to put back to the box and take apart again. So they offered r $31.57as a partial refund and did not offered the wrong part to change at All. Horrible product horrible experience
customer_reviews.author: AndreaBesszer

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst things I bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst things I've ever bought. It came in all kinds of pieces. Had to have help putting it together. Then it hurt your feet so badd to hang upside down. Not enough padding.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this! It will literally break your neck!
customer_reviews.text: My brother in law was using this when the assembly that holds your feet in place BROKE OFF! It dropped him on his head breaking his C5 vertebra in his neck. He has an appointment with a neurosurgeon this week to determine just how badly he was injured by this faulty equipment. Save your money and possibly your life, buy an inversion table from a safer company.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my eyes and gives me a headache
customer_reviews.text: I have perfect blood pressure (115/65), and have no glaucoma, but hanging upside down hurts my eyes and gives me a headache, even at 45 degrees. Ouch. The machine itself is a little rickety, but for the price at $90 with free Prime Shipping it would be a great value if I could actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: M+A

customer_reviews.title: Love it, a daily ritual
customer_reviews.text: Who knew that hanging upside down would be this much fun? He wakes up and hangs before coffee; then he hangs before lunch (after mowing the yards), then he may hang again for a few minutes in the late afternoon. Often he hangs before bedtime for 15 minutes. My man is on this device several times a day (every day) and his neck and back pain is pretty much gone. I hung a few times and it helps my back adjust naturally and easily.
customer_reviews.author: DanaMite

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Required
customer_reviews.text: Well, I didn't expect to be inverted 5 minutes after I opened the box. But this item gives real meaning to "assembly required" --see pic!!! Took me 30 minutes to unpack all of the parts. Started putting it together, but it got late. Will probably take around 2 hours to assemble (but I am going slow to make sure I do it right). I used to use a friends table, but moved so I have to buy my own. His was in the $300 range. This seems to be every bit as solid as that one was. I think it's going to work out well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this death trap
customer_reviews.text: Just left the hospital. The leg holder malfunction on this thing and I nearly broke my neck. If I hadn't reacted quickly and turn to my shoulderwhile falling I wouldn't be writing this review. But now I'm out of work for two weeks with a sprained shoulder.... And a sore back. I'll never use again.
customer_reviews.author: charisa

customer_reviews.title: Not so heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: My disappointment with this purchase is the area you place your feet. It feels a bit cheap in this area. I think the metal should be thicker. In addition, the braces that go against your shins I wish were larger and lower. You have to keep your feet flexed to keep from sliding out when you are inverted. So, I don't feel so relaxed needing to keep my ankles flexed. Otherwise, it will help my back, it just could be more comfortable in the feet area.
customer_reviews.author: Bob/Mary

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness
customer_reviews.text: I'm a second year medical student, and I had been dealing with lower thoracic/upper lumbar right sided lumbar pain that got worse throughout the day. I immediately felt relief of my back pain and a very substantial correctional pull at the right iliac crest--which makes me think that my pain was caused as a result of a tight quadratus lumborum. Regardless, this worked, and I don't really know how I would otherwise consistently stretch my QL as effective as this. I also understand the science behind disk hydration, and I think this can definitely do wonders with herniated disc problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had back problems most of my life. Over 30 years in a steel mill, working on farms bucking hay and digging horse radish, flying through the woods on dirt bikes and many other things that have taken its toll on my back. And I HATE taking anything for pain, so have tried chiropractors and what ever else to get through the day. I've been looking at reviews on these things for sometime and finally decided to purchase one...GLAD I DID, don't particularly like hanging upside down but it really does work, so it's worth it. As far as the one I bought, it's well made, has different level angles and easy to assemble. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David Parkhurst

customer_reviews.title: 100% sturdy and works really well!
customer_reviews.text: No joke this thing is amazing! I cannot believe how sturdy it is. Do you see the price and you just question everything, right? I know I did! Really is amazing! My husband and I have been wanting one for years but refused to spend $300 to $400. I found this on a whim and after reading the reviews I thought I’d give it a try. We are so glad we did
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the right circumstances. Assembly moderately challenging.
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this for my mom who is a bit older. I’d say the product is fine if you have a younger person available who is good at assembly and will personally supervise the entire exercise. Otherwise the assembly is challenging due to multiple steps and sometimes tiny diagrams that led to a few correctable errors in assembly. It is plenty sturdy for my 5ft /130lb mom. I do not feel it is all that safe for her to use alone as entry and exit are challenging for an older person with back pain and limited eyesight. It’s a good value but not for the solo older person with pain and typical older person eyesight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: arrived damaged....
customer_reviews.text: This inversion table is marvelous, helps relieve my lower back pain. Unfortunately, it arrived damaged - small cut in the vinyl on the right side of the main table body. It isn't much of a cut, but with the material that the table is covered with, this cut will expand. I'm not returning the table because I had already thrown the box away and repacking it would take more time than it's worth. If the table was discounted for the defect, I'd be very satisfied with my purchase, but paying full price for a damage item isn't my idea of a good deal. So, bottom line, table is great - packing of product for shipping poor.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Bourgea

customer_reviews.title: Hurts Ankles To Much
customer_reviews.text: I want to like it and I think it would really help my back pain if I could actually invert, however it hurts the ankles far more than any relief I'm getting. I don't know how people could even stand more than 30 seconds inverted, it's quite an intense ankle pain. I guess if you don't care to go all the way back and only slightly back where it won't strain the ankles, this would work well... but if you are planning to go all the way back (nearly completely upside down) it will hurt the ankles so much that your body will tense very hard which I doubt is accomplishing any good.
customer_reviews.author: BuyTryReview

customer_reviews.title: Private Chiropractor
customer_reviews.text: I’m an 80 year old female and assembled this alone. (Thanks UPS for getting it inside.) I’m delighted to say that I moved it, piece by piece, to the bedroom I intended for use. All parts were sorted on the top of the bed including the instruction book. Great instructions. I did have to use a tall orchid table to hold and connect the heaviest part. I’m not going to tell you how many days it took. I now use it at least three times daily for 8 minutes each as my chiropractor suggested and have had wonderful results. No more do I wake in morning with pain.
customer_reviews.author: Sputz

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat it for the price :)
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about hanging upside down like a bat but !!!!! My wife uses it daily and it has really helped her. Every evening after work she spends only 2-3 minutes on it and every day she states she loves it ! Even I was surprised at the stretch it gave me and the relief. Literally feel taller ! Has eased the pain in my back and neck where I have several compact discs. Ergonomic wise is up the the individual but I have not tried but a few of these. Can't beat it for the price and functionality :)
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M.

customer_reviews.title: I believe you should first talk to an orthopedist about using it if you already have sciatica pain
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to assemble, not impossible but hard. It's very sturdy. I did felt it decompressing my spine but since I already had a herniated disk it may even made it worst... not the products fault. Please speak with an orthopedist before using it specially if you are in the middle of a treatment. If you want to decompress your spine to maybe avoid an issue it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: george coelho silva

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It's too soon to tell if will help my back and I don't think a product review should be substituted for medical advice. That said, this product is solid (not what I would call heavy duty) and is plenty strong enough for my 200 lbs. It was pretty simple for me to assemble. Definitely worth the cost. I would also add I was missing a part, just the feet. I emailed Innova, provided them with my receipt, and 2 days later I had the parts. Simple and good customer service, just the way it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Peddie

customer_reviews.title: Took away my pain.
customer_reviews.text: I was having really bad back pain, so much that I could not hardly put my shoes on in the morning. I bought this and felt immediate relief. I have to be honest. I took a naproxen and used this for 3 days in a row and I am sure that it helped. It is a little work to put it together and when you are in pain already, you may need help moving the box. Start out slow and work your way upside down. If you have lower back pain or sciatica, pinched nerve ect, this may be for you.
customer_reviews.author: BTMOORE

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.text: Bulky as ever. Hard to move around with the legs swaying everywhere. Didn't get one "crack" out of my back and after a couple weeks noticed NO difference. Can't return cause it's huge so now I have to get rid of it on Craigslist
customer_reviews.author: Emonte85

customer_reviews.title: Great inversion table
customer_reviews.text: First and only inversion I have ever used...I love it and it has helped my back pain..My doctor recommended an inversion table and after looking at several more expensive units on the internet, I went with this one totally on price & ratings. Great decision as I do not see what a more expensive one would give me than this one does not. Bob
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: After four Chiropractors not helping but actually making my Sciatica worse I finally thought I's give inversion a try. Within two days of using this machine for only five minutes two times a day I am able to walk again with very minimal to no pain. I can carry my grand kids again which is amazing because it hurt so bad before. Just a slight warning is that your back muscles will have a slight aches from stretching but it will subside quickly (a few days). This machine has changed my life with no doubt. Thanks so much for this life saving product! Hands down it's the best purchase I have made in years.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget (inversion table)
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my wife who has spine issues. Assembly was very easy, but I recommend you assemble it in the room you intend to leave it, I changed rooms after it was assembled and it is a bit of a hassle. My wife was afraid of it initially and eventually, I coaxed her on to it. She had the sudden realization that this inversion table is not so scary and actually helped to relieve the pain in her back. Relieving her back pain makes this purchase worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very sturdy. It took about 1 hour to assemble. Easy to use. It does one thing. It inverts. It works really well. The first time I used it I felt oddly better. I use it twice a day for 5 minutes. I have not been past 45 degrees. I’ve been using it for 2 weeks now. I actually look forward to using it. I have had much improvement in my back and buttock pain that I’ve had for several years now. I did much research on inversion tables. This is a great product. Basic, does the job, sturdy and works for me.
customer_reviews.author: pk

customer_reviews.title: Does it's thing
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply, this holds me and my 6'2" 200 lb frame upside down with confidence and its easy to lower and raise without much effort. It's supposed to do one thing, that's all I need it to do and for that this is more than affordable. Took maybe an hour to assemble. It needs 7'x3' of floor space to work unobstructed. It's made in China which I expect for this price. Please ignore the mostly nonsense in negative reviews below - I continue to be amazed at people's expectations and gripes. You'll notice its the same mindset behind slip-and-fall lawsuits and on-line haters etc - it's their right of course but I find it offensive.
customer_reviews.author: john kirsimagi

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I have experienced low back pain since 2002. A few years ago I tried a friend’s inversion table and after two or three sessions the pain was gone. Early in the fall of 2019 the pain returned and so I ordered this one and after a couple of 3-5 minute sessions the pain was gone again. Now I use it once or twice a week and am still pain free. This is an excellent device and has worked for me when nothing else did. It’s inexpensive, easy to assemble, and more that adequate for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd W. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Five stars without a doubt
customer_reviews.text: First I think it goes without saying that if you are looking at equipment like this you need to be relatively healthy and not extremely overweight. That being said I bought the inversion table for low back pain which has completely been relieved. Now of course I’m sure there are models that offer additional features although not certain what they would be but what I am certain of is that this device for what you get for the price Is without a doubt a great deal as it is extremely sturdy appears very well-made I have zero complaints. I would highly recommend if you suffer from back pain
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: The item seems to be good quality, sturdy enough. I'm five eight 160 lbs..
customer_reviews.text: I could not comment on the pain relief as of yet I just started using it. I did have an inversion table before. Not this particular one, but the one I had at the time I needed it definitely helped with spine pain. So I'm hoping for the same results. What I don't like about these inversion tables is the pressure on my ankles and feet. I can never find a comfortable position. It feels good to be upside down for my spine, but man the ankles and feet scream! I try wearing boots, fatter socks. Nothings working for me.
customer_reviews.author: ThatKat

customer_reviews.title: I can move!
customer_reviews.text: Truly amazing product and method overall. The stretch this provides is unlike any other. Having a herniation in my lumbosacral joint after a sports injury life sucked for months. I refused to have any surgery. Then this sucker came along. Along with Mckenzie stretches and core training, inversions have made all the difference. I can now move freely and pain free. If you are at your wits end with back pain, try this. Just be patient and dedicate time towards your healing.
customer_reviews.author: SGK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what ive needed for years at a reasonable price. Ive used many boards over the years and I got this priced at 99$ with a birthday giftcard. It is by far the best inversion table ive used including ones upwards of 400$. My 4 year old actually helped and was capable of helping me assemble it it was so easy. Ive been in 27 car accidents where ive never been at fault and fallen 60 feet onto solid ground. This has been one of the best investments in my quality of life for pain management.
customer_reviews.author: Zoely B

customer_reviews.title: Too big for storage, somewhat heavy
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat easy to put together, directions are not that great, but the pictures do the trick. It is comfortable to use. My biggest complaint is storing it. It is way too large to store anywhere. I am looking at it in my living room right now wondering where I am going to put it. I would box up and return if it qouldnt take so long. The bulk of it and the amount of space it takes up is not worth keeping around, I will be trying to sell it as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I would recommend this to anyone that has back pain if you can handle it. I suffer from kyphosis and it is very hard on my back. I tried seconds and minutes and it made my back worse. But if you have minimal back pain or can handle that then I would totally recommend it. It feels better just to lay on it like you're laying on the table and not upside down. Make sure someone is there that can handle getting it up into your house and set up because it is super super super super heavy and make sure you have a place for it because it is super bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of equipment for your home gym...
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product that works well. As the other reviews say, it does take about two hours to assemble and careful attention to the instructions. The product arrived on time. The packaging was intact and all the parts were included and clearly marked. Even the tools needed to assemble are included, but I used my own ratchet wrench which made the job quite a bit easier. It is a solid piece of equipment. You feel very secure as you use it and it works as I expected. We just started using it, but can already feel the difference in our backs. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent relief for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, and it provides a decent amount of pain relief. A 30 degree incline is sufficient for a good amount of relief without going to the full upside down, Michael Keaton as Batman inversion. Definitely wear shoes when doing this, or otherwise you have to flex your ankles to stay in place, which doesn't allow you to totally relax. Avoid giving yourself a pile driver. Wear the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Take it easy
customer_reviews.text: Assembling wasn’t horrible, but it could definitely be easier. Perhaps they should coordinate with IKEA on instructions. It’s very sturdy. I’m 250lbs 6’ and it handles me without a problem. Take your time and ease into it over the first several weeks. Don’t do it daily in the first week or 2 because you will be mega sore (first hand experience). Listen to your body. It will provide relief in time. It takes time getting used to. But it does help lower back issues pretty well. Decompression of the spine always helps alleviate back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Prfine

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: The foot clamps are not very well designed, in my opinion. Anyone could slip out, fall on their head and possible break their neck. My suggestion for anyone looking for a gravity inversion device is to spend a little more money and get the "Hang-Up" I think it's called. That one is state-of-the-art and has been on the market for many years. The quality of the leg clamps is a critical component of these types of devices, so you should get a good one, if you want to avoid a permanent injury.
customer_reviews.author: will f.

customer_reviews.title: This works for sciatica like a dream!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband suffered from sciatica for over 3 months with severe leg symptoms but this device literally cured his problem. He started on the lowest setting working his way up to the mid setting currently. He uses it a few minutes every day. He is an active, fit 65-year-old. I work in pain management and wish I could share this with all our patients; however, I am only an administrative assistant so it is not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E

customer_reviews.title: Just tap add to cart !
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, it even comes with all the tools needed for assembly ! I am a Memphis Firefighter and build transmissions on my days off . While building transmissions I had to take a break because my back would be killing me. I've used this thing about 5 time, my back is sore as in it's getting used to something different but my back does not hurt at all. Warring ! if you have crazy dogs like mine , put them up or be prepared to have your faced licked off !
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for over a year and it’s been a great investment. Installation was pretty straightforward and nothing has broken or malfunctioned so far. It does take a bit of space in your house, but if you can fit it, it’s worth it. I got it to help with sciatic pain and decompress my spine. If you use it, it works. You get out what you put into it. It has a few different angle settings, so you don’t have to use it straight upside down if you don’t want to.
customer_reviews.author: Viper Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Fully functional inversion table/chair
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" 214, and my wife is 5'7". Very stable and sturdy, well engineered. One person can operate it while you are on the table. My first try was very invigorating, something "popped" in my mid back, and I felt like I could breathe an extra gallon of air. My wife has pinched nerve l4/5 and her first try gave her immediate relief. I had room to square my arms over my head while inverted. Assembly instructions were detailed, and prevented "reversal" mistakes. We are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and huge amount of pain relief!♡
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from chronic pain in my lower back and hips. I could hardly walk and going up and down the stairs was horrible. I put the table together myself in in an hour (I did steal better tools from my husband). It is very sturdy. I use it twice a day for just over a month. My hips feel so much better I can actually move around and do more things. It has been a very long time since I have walked without a limp. I just moved to the 35°angle last week. I can't wait to see how I feel when I move on to 45°.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Marie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble, extremely sturdy, EASY TO MOVE
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with this inversion table. It is really easy to move with it's folding form and it is really impressive quality for the price. I have rarely been more pleased with a purchase on Amazon. I kinda gagged when my chiropractor told me they were $249, so I was so happy with this purchase. It's easy to get up and down (okay, you have to develop a bit of technique) and it's super easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: After a month of searching - I settled on this table....
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine today - I have been using it 5-10 minutes throughout the day every now and then. I love this product - took some time to put together but directions are super easy - only complaint i have is the strain it puts on the top of your feet. Be prepared for that but otherwise best bang for your buck is in this machine! Forgot to mention - came with a tiny tear. But I guess I'll survive....
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy, everything was laid out well, the instructions were easy to follow. The table is extremely sturdy and I use it all the time with 100% confidence. I have been weight lifting most of my life and being able to use this table, relieves a lot of stress on my lower back. IT is an excellent product, I recommend it highly and the price was less than I would have expected to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen J Santora

customer_reviews.title: used regulary helps with pain better than any script
customer_reviews.text: ive had this product for a few years now and my back has never felt better. doctors told me between Degen disk and 3 bad disks i would get worse and need surgery. well this product combined with a exercise routine i am more flexible than ever. just be careful the first few times you use this product i recommend starting on the first pin setting and only use for a couple minutes here and there. My first time i fell asleep at the 3rd pin setting for 20 minutes and couldn't stand up for a week so please be careful. used correctly it is an amazing product
customer_reviews.author: joel olsen

customer_reviews.title: HIGH QUALITY & PAIN RELIEF AFTER 2 SPINAL SURGERIES
customer_reviews.text: I have. 7 ruptured discs in my lower and middle back. This inversion table really helps with flexibility and relieves my pain. The table is well made and can do heavy duty. I am 6' 4" and weigh 230 pounds. It handles me with ease. It adjusts for varying heights, so my friends and family have also been able to use it. I am very impressed with this item and reccomend it. For under a hundred dollars, it is an incredible deal. Being able to put myself in traction has really helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a week now and I love it. The only problem I've had is small feet and ankles so mine don't fit very well. I solved it by wearing my doc martens when I use it to be sure my feet stay snug. This is in no way a reflection on the machine just an fyi for smaller folks. If I knew this upfront it would not prevent me from purchasing it. It is a great price point and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is total garbage. After taking 3 hours to install. You have to really struggle to push yourself back to be even laying flat on it. Good inversion tables are so balanced at the time that you get in it all you have to do is put your arms back to start falling backwards this thing you put your arms all the way back and you don't even move you have to really push yourself with the handlebars to even get your started. Which is not good at all. Do not buy. I'm returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This inversion table does just what it is supposed too. It stretches your lumbar and I suggest to go easy at first with the 30 degree angle and after a period of time adjust it if needed. I don't need to use it every day but do so about 3-4 times a week. It might take a longer time for me to see a major reduction in pain because my back has been very bad for a lot of years and it may take prolonged use of it to see a very positive cessation of pain in my sciatica. All in all it works and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: For the money, its a great product. Be mindful of the assembly instructions, because this one can be complex for most. Make sure you follow them to the letter (instructions are well written) and you will have no problems. I've been using this everyday for about 3 weeks (five minute intervals) and after just a couple days, I could tell a difference. No more upper back pain. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: headrest was unadjustable and ripped off upon unscrewing
customer_reviews.text: I'm really not one to put 1 star reviews unless necessary. The headrest ripped off when unscrewing. I am outside the return window and pretty bummed with my investment in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Churd66

customer_reviews.title: will ruin your ankles if you're a man and use as is
customer_reviews.text: Realised after a single 10 minute use that by design it places far too much load on your ankles joints I had to order the inversion boots so that i didn't dislocate my damn foot from my leg. lol The whole unit as a whole is a great value, but just be aware that if you weight more than about 150 lb (im 180) you're going to do damage to to your ankle if full inverting for long periods of time. Your foot and ankle just aren't designed to support that weight and this thing is too cheap to include a proper support system. still a decent buy. overall this and the boots is 140.
customer_reviews.author: O. Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Didn't help my back pain
customer_reviews.text: It was sturdy, easy to assemble, and I felt safe in it. I ended up selling it because I never felt pain relief or noticed that it did anything for me. Also, I hated the feeling of all the blood going to my head from being upside down. It may work for some, and maybe it was used error, but I tried it for a few months, and I didn't notice any difference. What I did like: The leg holders and padded nicely, so it was comfortable. The back cushion was also comfortable. The adjustability of it is nice and it is easy to change to different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: It hurts the ankles
customer_reviews.text: So this thing has the potential to be great, only problem is that in terms of comfortability, this thing is harsh on the ankles You hang upside down and the only thing stopping you from falling is your ankles that are getting squished by the plastic and foam padding. If it had a strap for your foot to be tied down as well, it would probably release some pressure from the ankles making it possible to hang more than a minute
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A.

customer_reviews.title: WHO
customer_reviews.text: Who, exactly, is held responsible for these mishaps? Several people, yesterday, told me they found my house on Google Earth yet, I was told the driver couldn't find my house. I was told that another attempt would be made to deliver, by Romario, it never happened. I was told, today, by Sean M and Will that it would be delivered, today. I then receive an email from Elyn "asking" that I "allow" them till Thursday to deliver something that should have arrived YESTERDAY. I was told, by Juana, today, that someone from heavy and bulk would reach out to me. It hasn't happened. I WANT AN ANSWER!
customer_reviews.author: Curt Knull

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price - Easy enough to put together
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, we had borrowed my neighbors much higher end table for many months, and while there are differences, they are minor for the price. The most glaring is the foot release being hard to reach. My husband has back problems and is recovering from Hernia surgery, so bending over that far is sometimes a problem. I usually just have to help him out, but again, for saving several hundred dollars it was worth it for us.
customer_reviews.author: L. Morris

customer_reviews.title: helpz with sciatica and bulged degenerative discs
customer_reviews.text: i can't say enough good things about this table. saves me money. i was going to chiropractor 3-4x a wk. and wasnt getting much relief for my sciatic nerve. but this table has changed all that 2-10min when i get home from work and i get relief til next morning. life saver. pain depresses you and i was getting to a bad place mentally. its helped me in many many ways con: i have to wear work boots so the ankle restraint doesn't hurt my ankles. but i am a tall skinny person. flipping the foam pads to the front does help with that also. everyone is different so its subjective.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Years of knee pain gone in a week
customer_reviews.text: Product is sturdy and very helpful. I bought it for my back pain which has gotten a little better with using it every other day. The big reason I gave this product 5 stars is because my knee pain is practically gone. After a week of use my knee pain almost went away. I broke my knee, femur,and tore my acl years ago and every day had pain. After a week pain went away. I skipped the board for 5 days and pain was back. After 2 days of use I could walk down the stairs and run without limping with stiffness and pain. I would give 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: billy marsh

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and it’s very sturdy. We’ve used in on carpet and hardwood floors. The ankle supports are a little bit uncomfortable when your laying all the way back but just adjust you feet a little and that will help. Very good construction, very sturdy, would definitely recommend (especially at this price!)
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great product at cheaper cost for people with sciatica pains
customer_reviews.text: I had l4- l5 disc surgery 3 years back and started developing sciatica and low back pain which shoots through my left leg. I scheduled some appointment with chiropractor, want to figure out to avoid chiropractor copays and pain killer and pain balm. After lot of research I got this inversion table. OMG, this is great, after two days of inverting 5 mins in morning evening and night, three times a day I feel really good. No copays no pain killers no pain releiving roll on or .this is lot cheaper than few others. I hop on to this when I feel some pain. Assembling just took 2 hours and with the manual provided.
customer_reviews.author: Balaji Soundararajan

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a very solid piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed by the quality of this very reasonably priced inversion table. Assembly took some time, but the instructions and packaging were very good and I was able to assemble it by myself until the very end, when I had to ask my wife to help with the last few steps. I purchased this on advice from my neurosurgeon to treat pain caused by spinal stenosis and a slipped disc. So far, I have seen positive results, though I am still early in my treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Busch

customer_reviews.title: What a Godsend!!
customer_reviews.text: This table is amazing. It's Rock solid, heavy duty and assembles quickly. I'm a Dental Assistant, putting my back in wrong positions all day long. I've had back issues for many years, seeing a chiropractor often, to fix me. After purchasing this table 7 mos. ago, I have not been back. 10 mins in the am, 10 mins before bed and my back is amazing all day and all night. I really am glad I made this purchase. $80 investment has saved me hundreds. I only have it set on 30 degrees! My husband loves it, too. You can adjust the settings for any height/weight quick & easy!
customer_reviews.author: Patti Jo Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had paid the extra for the 9700 or 9900
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy device, took my time assembling and spent about 1 1/2 hours. I did use my wrenches and screw drivers rather what was included with the kit. Only real negative is the ankle holder and having to bend over to set or release it. With a bad back it makes it difficult. If I had to purchase again I would purchase the 9700 or 9900. I've have used a similar system to those two models and it was a lot easier to set and release my ankles and caused less pain on my ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Dd

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: To bulky there are better ones out there that seem to work better and are not as bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Whiplash

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE, SOLID CONSTRUCTION
customer_reviews.text: I've had inversion tables before years (decades, let;s be honest) ago, and with recent back pain decided to get another. This is VERY well made for $111, which is what I paid on fabulous Amazon. The only valuable tip I would provide is to order one of these from Amazon as well:  It's a kneeling pad. If you cut it into two squares it really helps make this table more comfortable. The rounded cups that lock against the lower legs (just above the ankle) just aren't padded enough, but these improvised pads made all the difference. As far as construction, it was easily to put together in about an hour, with a minimal amount of improvisation. Happy hanging!
customer_reviews.author: S Graves

customer_reviews.title: It's like magic
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about 3 years now. Lower back, 2 bulging disk, arthritis, bone on bone. Back pain was just something I lived with. Working on my office at home, after an hour of sitting I would hobble down the stairs to get a coffee, very painful. Now I hobble to the next room, get on this table for 2 minutes, and my back feels great. Very sturdy, not hard to assemble if you follow directions. Doesn't fold enough to slide under the bed, although mine never gets put away, I use it often. I was seeing a neurosurgeon to consider surgery when I purchased this, I don't see him anymore.
customer_reviews.author: SteveM

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality equipment
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this purchase. I use it all the time, by myself (i.e., very safe and easy to use). It relieves pressure on my lower back and seems to produce a very impressive pain reduction response. I definitely recommend this table if someone is considering purchasing inversion equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Early Adopter

customer_reviews.title: Inversion Table
customer_reviews.text: The 52 pound box arrived, early this morning. It took about 2 hrs to put together, good instructions. It’s a solid piece of equipment. I tried it out for about 10 minutes and my back, with bulging discs and fractured vertebrae, is screaming at me right now. I’m hoping with time, I’ll get used to it and stretch my spinal column.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great for back pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: Great investment! My husband and I both suffer from severe back pain. I’ve had low back surgery and have a good many flare ups that make it Very difficult to stand up straight for several days at a time. Since using this, both my husband and I have had a lot of relief and can stand and walk straight. You have to try out various adjustments for height vs. weight to get the best results. Very sturdy product. You really only need a couple of minutes a day to get relief. I highly recommend this product to anyone suffering from back and/or back pain.
customer_reviews.author: tantill

customer_reviews.title: Assembly ease and use
customer_reviews.text: Product is well engineered, manufacturing is excellent, Quality Control is outstanding, assembly was a little under an hour. All bolting material and tools supplied with machine. What you need for ease of assembly is a 13mm open or box end wrench and 13 mm socket with ratchet handle. (assembly time faster). My wife is and old Aerobics instructor, knees and back start to wear after 40 years of instruction, the INNOVA inversion table has helped width the pain and mobility problems. If you buy this item you will not be disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: 2cats

customer_reviews.title: Very good inversion table
customer_reviews.text: The table is good quality, relatively easy to assemble. It is sturdy, and adjustable to any degree of inversion, from slightly inclined (good for stretching exercises) to vertical. Be aware that you won't want to be vertical for too long! Even a moderate degree of inversion helps to "crack" your back, if that's what you're looking to do. I would not say it's been a quick cure for a tight or sore back, but I would definitely say it has loosened my back up and made me more comfortable in general.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mund

customer_reviews.title: This very sturdy inversion table is well made and good assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this several months now and I am very pleased with this product. This inversion table is very sturdy and has helped a family member get relief from pain due to a pinched nerve in their back. I assist as this is an elderly member of the household. I tried it out myself and did not see any safety issues with the equipment itself. The assembly instructions were very good. This device does require some floor space and not some piece of light weight tubing. The welds and hardware are of good quality. The product quality is excellent for the price. Everything is strong and we use this every other day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Just got this like 2 1/2 weeks ago so I’ll update my review after a few months...I’ll start with assembly, took about an hr to assemble. Some of the screws weren’t working at first so I worried I was going to have to return but I finally got them in. The instructions were ok but I think they could be written better. Been using a few times in the last few weeks and it seems to be helping relieve some back issues. I will say as far as storage it’s big so have room for it. Not super heavy to move around (had to carry it upstairs because I had to assemble in living room).
customer_reviews.author: Erica C

customer_reviews.title: Gentle inversion table.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Sixteen months of serious back issues are rapidly improving. I am 71 and have been to chiropractors, back doctor and acupuncturist with virtually no results. One month on this machine has done wonders without any of the damaging effects of the old-style, upside-down machine that really damaged my knees and ankles. I've been amazed at the results of the 15-degee incline. Be sure to read carefully who should not use this machine before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: L P Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Was amazed at the quality of this unit - we bought it for $100 shipped, and now it looks like it's even cheaper at the moment. Has really helped my back problems. It gets used daily. Costs about the same as a single doctor visit these days. Took a couple hours (at a leisurely pace) to put together. Instructions were easy to follow, cheap tools included, but even easier if you have a set of metric ratchet wrenches. If I ever do have an issue, I will update this review, but so far, EXCELLENT.
customer_reviews.author: Amatek

customer_reviews.title: Lower back problems?  great spine decompression.
customer_reviews.text: I don't often write reviews but this machine definitely deserves a shout-out. Very sturdy steel and can bear my 295 lb weight easily. Excellent safety features -no "safety tether". There is a screw in bolt that set the inversion angle and prevents the table from going any further therefore being the safety. Nice cushion and foot retention-very comfy and adjustable. I am no physician and do not just recommend this for everyone but if you have lower back problems (confirmed by MRI and my MD) and back decompression is recommended I would recommend this unit highly.Great buy compared to the $600 plus units.
customer_reviews.author: archer9926

customer_reviews.title: Big Help in our household
customer_reviews.text: This inversion table has made a big difference. Multiple people use it and adjusting it for different heights is easy. This was easy to assemble and it is sturdy! I considered purchasing a used inversion table (different brand) and I am very glad that I didn't. This brand is more sturdy than the cheaper ones out there. As far as pain relief, using this inversion table has made a big improvement. I now have more flexibility in my spine. It's very satisfying when I stretch and have a greater range of movement.
customer_reviews.author: FL LP

product_meta.title: Innova Heavy Duty Inversion Table
feature_bullets: Adjustable headrest pad with large and comfortable padded backrest.
Six (6) position Adjustable pin system with added Patent Pending Protective Cover for easy positioning and safer inverting over strap systems
True Balance system for easy inverting with ergonomically & reversible ankle holding system
Adjustable headrest pad with large and comfortable padded backrest
Accommodates users 4ft-10in to 6ft-6in with a 300 lbs. weight capacity
NOTE: Please refer to the user manual before use

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
